title: Understanding Ecell◦ and Spontaneity
text: The standard cell potential (Ecell◦) is a measure of the driving force behind an electrochemical reaction. A positive Ecell◦ indicates a spontaneous reaction under standard conditions. What does this imply about the Gibbs free energy change (∆Go)?

title: Relationship Between Ecell◦ and ∆Go
text: Recall the relationship between the standard cell potential (Ecell◦) and the Gibbs free energy change (∆Go): $$∆Go=-nFEcell◦$$. What does a positive Ecell◦ mean for ∆Go?

title: Calculating ∆Go from Ecell◦
text: Given the equation $$∆Go=-nFEcell◦$$, if Ecell◦ is positive, what will be the sign of ∆Go?

title: Conclusion on Spontaneity
text: If ∆Go is negative, what does this indicate about the spontaneity of the reaction?

title: Final Answer
text: Based on the relationship between Ecell◦ and ∆Go, is the statement 'Positive Ecell◦ value is an indicator of a non-spontaneous reaction and hence the Gibbs free energy change (∆Go) will be positive' true or false?
